‚ú® and much more!

name: Grace Hopper

Grace

Grace

‚ú® helped develop the compiler for #COBOL, a key programming language
‚ú® first to use 'bug' and 'debugging' for computer issues üêû (https://bit.ly/3V2mamK)
‚ú® broke barriers as the first female recipient of the National Medal of Technology in 1991 (https://bit.ly/4bD7kdy)
‚ú® and much more!

name: Ada Lovelace
description_bluesky:
Ada
‚ú® was a mathematician and the first computer programmer
‚ú® worked on early calculators with Charles Babbage
‚ú® envisioned machines following patterns, not just numbers‚Äîearly computer programming in the 1840s!
description_mastodon:
Ada
‚ú® was a mathematician and the first computer programmer
‚ú® worked on early versions of a calculator (with Charles Babbage)
‚ú® imagined the machine following patterns and not only calculating numbers but also forming letters - the basic version of computer programming was described in the 1840s!
‚ú® and much more!
alt: Image of Ada Lovelace (a brown-haired person wearing a flower in her hair). The image has a darker background with nebula and a mathematical formula.

name: Sophie Germain
description_bluesky:
Sophie
‚ú® was a pinoneering mathematician, physicist, and philosopher
‚ú® broke gender barriers to study math & corresponded with Gauss under a pseudonym
‚ú® contributed to number theory & elasticity ‚Äî foundations for cryptography & physics
‚ú® has Sophie Germain primes & a prize named after her

name: Frances Allen
description_bluesky:
Frances
‚ú® was an IBM pioneer in high-performance and parallel computing
‚ú® was the first female IBM Fellow and first female Turing Award winner
‚ú® was a role model for women in tech and advocate for inclusion
